Select box

v0.1a

Implementing this component

The Markup

				
<form id="form-select" class="t-white">
	<label for="select-box" class="select-box-label">Custom select</label>
	<div class="select-box-wrapper">
		<select id="select-box" class="select-box">
			<option>Option 1</option>
			<option>Option 2</option>
			<option>Option 3</option>
			<option>Option 4</option>
		</select>
	</div>
</form>

The CSS: Theming

				
/*
//Select Box theming
*/
.t-white .select-box-wrapper {
    background: #fff url('../img/icon-arrow.svg') no-repeat 97% 50%;
    border: 1px solid #2a1244;
}
.no-svg .t-white .select-box-wrapper {
/* fall back for no SVG, using modernizr */
    background-image: url('../img/icon-arrow.png');
}
/* the option needs to be styled for Internet Explorer 10/11 */
.t-white .select-box-wrapper select,
.t-white .select-box-wrapper select option {
    color: #697070;
}
/* In some browsers you won't see the outline
(seems to be fine in Chrome but others not so much)
so we need to communicate keyboard focus state to the user.
*/
.t-white .select-box-wrapper select:active,
.t-white .select-box-wrapper select:focus {
/* this is transparent so you can still see the arrow when it hilights */
 background-color: rgba(249, 241, 155, 0.5);
}

The CSS: Component

				
                /*
Optional reset of auto-zoom
What this snippet does is: stop the automatic focus zoom on small screen devices,
this doesn't take away the option to zoom,
instead it leaves it up to the user.
*/
@media all and (max-width:60em) {
    select:focus,
    select:hover {
        font-size:1em;
    }
}
.select-box-wrapper input::-ms-clear,
.select-box-wrapper input::-ms-reveal {
    display:none; /* Aggressively resetting IE's default for this */
}

.select-box-label {
	display:block;
	margin:1em 0;
}
.select-box-wrapper:hover,
.select-box-wrapper:focus,
.select-box-wrapper:active {
	cursor: pointer;
}

//needs to house the select in order to work
.select-box-wrapper {
    border-radius: 5px;
    font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;
    font-size: 1em;
    line-height: 1em;
    margin: 0;
    overflow: hidden;
    position: relative;
    transition: background-color 0.4s ease-in-out;
    width: 100%;
}

.select-box-wrapper select option {

    padding:0.5em;
    line-height:1.5;
    font-size:1em;
}
.select-box-wrapper select {

    -webkit-appearance: none;
    -moz-appearance: none;
    appearance: none;
    background-color: transparent;
    background-image: none;
    border: none;
    box-shadow: none;
    font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif;
    font-size: 1em;
    padding: 1em;
    transition: background 0.4s ease;
    width: 115%; /* This is what hides the default arrow */


}

The CSS: Supporting High Contrast

	
	/*
	High contrast mode disables background images,
	since this example uses a background image
	to replace a perceived affordance, we need to restore it if
	high contrast mode is enabled.
	Fortunately for windows 8 users,
	we have a media query available to detect the high contrast mode
	unfortunately, it only works in IE.
	You'll need a script to help you detect high contrast mode otherwise.

	*/
@media screen and (-ms-high-contrast: active) {
     /* All high contrast styling rules */
     .select-box-wrapper select {
        width: 100%;
     }
    }
    @media screen and (-ms-high-contrast: black-on-white) {
     .select-box-wrapper select {
        width: 100%;
     }
    }
    @media screen and (-ms-high-contrast: white-on-black) {
      .select-box-wrapper select {
        width: 100%;
     }
    }

/* requires a script to detect a change */
.high-contrast-mode .select-box-wrapper select {

    width: 100%;
}
